title.narrative: Delivery of Essential Hospital Health Services in Tarinkot Provincial Hospital, KUNAR

description.narrative: Delivery of Essential Hospital Health Services in Tarinkot Provincial Hospital, KUNAR
The Assabadad provincial hospital in Kunar operates 150 beds serving a catchment population of 458,000 people.

To improve access, utilization, and quality of hospital services in an equitable and sustainable manner, especially for emergency and routine Reproductive Health (RH) and Maternal & Child Health (MCH) care Services; 1. To establish a comprehensive referral system from and towards all levels of BPHS facilities 2. To establish and improve the quality of patient care (Inpatient and Outpatient) in hospital; 3. To respond the emergencies including mass casualties and provision of required services to returnees and Internal Displaced People (IDP); 4. To improve knowledge and skills of hospital health personnel in priority areas (e.g. maternal care, newborn and child care); 5. To ensure and maintain quality support services, including those for laboratory services, blood safety, radiology, pharmaceuticals, equipment and medical supplies; 6. To increase efficiency of hospital operation through establishing and maintaining of strong managerial arrangement and autonomy inside the hospital; The ultimate objectives of this assignment are to i) improve quality of care ii) improve equity in services delivery (increase hospital services for poor people) and iii) increase quantity of hospital care. On top of the RFP, the PBF will contribute to: 7. Improve the quality of the health data recording and reporting system and 8. Increase good governance and accountability in hospital setting.
